title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: Sometimes want draw text ggplot2 plot fits inside defined area. can manually fiddling font size, tedious un-reproducible. ggfittext provides geom called geom_fit_text() automatically resizes text fit inside box. works like :  geom_text(), position text set x y aesthetics. geom_fit_text() tries infer width height box text allowed fit, shrinks text big.
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggfittext) ggplot(animals, aes(x = type, y = flies, label = animal)) +   geom_tile(fill = "white", colour = "black") +   geom_fit_text()

title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: Another way make text fit box reflowing ; , wrapping multiple lines. reflow = TRUE argument, geom_fit_text() reflow text (still necessary) shrinking :
code: ggplot(animals, aes(x = type, y = flies, label = animal)) +   geom_tile(fill = "white", colour = "black") +   geom_fit_text(reflow = TRUE)

title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: want text large possible, argument grow = TRUE increase text size maximum fit box. works well conjunction reflow:
code: ggplot(animals, aes(x = type, y = flies, label = animal)) +   geom_tile(fill = "white", colour = "black") +   geom_fit_text(reflow = TRUE, grow = TRUE)

title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: default, text placed centre box. However, can place corner side box place argument, takes values like “top”, “topright”, “bottomleft” :
code: ggplot(animals, aes(x = type, y = flies, label = animal)) +   geom_tile(fill = "white", colour = "black") +   geom_fit_text(place = "topleft", reflow = TRUE)

title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: ggfittext also provides geom geom_bar_text() labelling bars bar plots:  geom_bar_text() works stacked bar plots:  works dodged bar plots, flipped bar plots:
code: ggplot(altitudes, aes(x = craft, y = altitude, label = altitude)) +   geom_col() +   geom_bar_text() ggplot(beverages, aes(x = beverage, y = proportion, label = ingredient,                     fill = ingredient)) +   geom_col(position = "stack") +   geom_bar_text(position = "stack", reflow = TRUE) ggplot(beverages, aes(x = beverage, y = proportion, label = ingredient,                     fill = ingredient)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   geom_bar_text(position = "dodge", grow = TRUE, reflow = TRUE,                  place = "left") +   coord_flip()

title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: want manually set limits box (instead inferred x y), can use xmin & xmax /ymin & ymax:  Alternatively, can set width /height width /height arguments, grid::unit() objects. horizontal /vertical centre box defined x /y.
code: ggplot(presidential, aes(ymin = start, ymax = end, x = party, label = name)) +   geom_fit_text(grow = TRUE) +   geom_errorbar(alpha = 0.5)

title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: rich = TRUE argument, geom_fit_text() geom_bar_text() support limited subset Markdown HTML markup text (rendered gridtext).  Rich text drawn polar coordinates. Please note feature liable change, subject upstream changes gridtext.
code: ggplot(animals_rich, aes(x = type, y = flies, label = animal)) +   geom_tile(fill = "white", colour = "black") +   geom_fit_text(reflow = TRUE, grow = TRUE, rich = TRUE)

what: Experimental feature: text in polar coordinates
title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: Text can drawn polar coordinates geom_fit_text() simply adding coord_polar() plot. feature experimental bug reports welcome.
code: ggplot(gold, aes(xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax,                   fill = linenumber, label = line)) +   coord_polar() +   geom_rect() +   geom_fit_text(min.size = 0, grow = TRUE) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "#fee391", high = "#238443")

title: Introduction to 'ggfittext'
text: arguments geom_fit_text() can also used geom_bar_text(). contrast can used automatically invert colour text contrasts background fill:  padding.x padding.y can used set padding text edge box. default 1 mm. values must given grid::unit() objects. min.size sets minimum font size points, default 4 pt. Text smaller hidden (see also outside). outside FALSE default geom_fit_text(). TRUE, text placed “top”, “bottom”, “left” “right” must shrunk smaller min.size fit box flipped outside box (fits ). mostly useful drawing text inside bars bar plot. hjust vjust set horizontal vertical justification text, scaled 0 (left/bottom) 1 (right/top). 0.5 default. formatter allows provide function applied text drawn. mostly useful contexts variables may interpolated, using gganimate. fullheight automatically set depending place, can overridden option. used determine bounding box around text. FALSE, bounding box includes x-height text ascenders, descenders. TRUE, extends top ascenders bottom descenders. mostly useful situations want ensure baseline text consistent labels (fullheight = FALSE), want avoid descenders spilling bounding box (fullheight = TRUE).
code: ggplot(animals, aes(x = type, y = flies, fill = mass, label = animal)) +   geom_tile() +   geom_fit_text(reflow = TRUE, grow = TRUE, contrast = TRUE)

title: A 'ggplot2' geom to fit text inside a box — geom_bar_text
text: mapping ggplot2::aes() object standard 'ggplot2'. Note aesthetics specifying box must provided. See Details. data, stat, position, na.rm, show.legend, inherit.aes, ... Standard geom arguments ggplot2::geom_text(). padding.x, padding.y Horizontal vertical padding around text, expressed grid::unit() objects. default 1 mm. min.size Minimum font size, points. Text need shrunk size fit box hidden. Defaults 4 pt (8 pt geom_bar_text()) place inside box place text. Default 'centre'; options 'topleft', 'top', 'topright', 'right', 'bottomright', 'bottom', 'bottomleft', 'left', 'center'/'middle' synonyms 'centre'. geom_bar_text(), set heuristically specified. outside TRUE, text placed one 'top', 'right', 'bottom' 'left' need shrunk smaller min.size fit box drawn outside box possible. mostly useful drawing text inside bar/column geoms. Defaults TRUE position = "identity" using geom_bar_text(), otherwise FALSE. grow TRUE, text grown well shrunk fill box. Defaults FALSE. reflow TRUE, text reflowed (wrapped) better fit box. Defaults FALSE. hjust, vjust Horizontal vertical justification text. default, automatically set appropriate values based place. fullheight TRUE, descenders counted resizing placing text; FALSE, x-height ascenders counted. main use option aligning text baseline (FALSE) preventing descenders spilling outside box (TRUE). default set automatically depending place grow. width, height using x /y aesthetics, set width /height box. either grid::unit() objects numeric values x y scales. formatter function applied text drawn. useful using geom_fit_text() context involving interpolated variables, 'gganimate' package. formatter applied serially element label column, need vectorised function. contrast TRUE combination fill aesthetic, colour text inverted better contrast dark background fills. FALSE default geom_fit_text(), set heuristically geom_bar_text(). rich TRUE, text formatted markdown HTML markup implemented gridtext::richtext_grob(). FALSE default. Rich text drawn polar coordinates. Please note rich text support experimental breaking changes likely flip TRUE, polar coordinates 'upside-' text flipped 'right way ', enhance readability.

title: A 'ggplot2' geom to fit text inside a box — geom_bar_text
text: Except noted, geom_fit_text() behaves less like ggplot2::geom_text(). three ways define box want text drawn. extents box x y axes independent, combination methods can used: x /y aesthetics used set location box, width height set automatically based number discrete values x /y. Alternatively, x /y aesthetics used, width /height box can overridden 'width' /'height' argument. grid::unit() objects; , assumed use native axis scale. boundaries box can set using aesthetics 'xmin' 'xmax', /'ymin' 'ymax'. text big box, shrunk fit box. grow = TRUE, text made fill box completely whether requires shrinking growing. reflow = TRUE cause text reflowed (wrapped) better fit box. text made fit reflowing alone, reflowed shrunk fit box. Existing line breaks text respected reflowing. geom_fit_text() includes experimental support drawing text polar coordinates (adding coord_polar() plot), however features available .
